description.narrative: Goal Overview: Primary school children taught by the graduated TTC teachers have a broad understanding of developing and maintaining a (door-size) home garden and they are able to apply this at home and spread the knowledge and skills to peers and their parents. The project will secure a widespread appreciation of the use of local vegetables and fruits, use of organic and human manure as well as of use of conservation gardening methods.

Project Plan: The project will be implemented in Teaching practice schools of DAPP Chilangoma Teachers Training Colleges in South West Education Division in Blantyre District. The DAPP Teacher Training Program has a duration of 2.5 year in Malawi. Students will have their practice period in the second year.

Summary: The Nutrition education and schoolgardens TTC2 is a follow up project of the 2011 project. Innovative ideas were brought to the college and the schools – the growing of local vegetables and fruits, involvement of even young children in the garden as well as the construction of latrines and use of human manure. The project has also gained valuable experience in cooperation with other stakeholders with in School Health and Nutrition in Malawi – both within the Ministry of Education Structures and in other NGOs. By extending the project for a few more years a bigger impact can be reached. The proposed extension of the project will be relying on the already implemented curriculum development and the experiences gained in teaching practice schools. Improvement en continuation of the demonstration gardens at the TTC and the gardens in the primary schools is needed for 2 years and at the same time to construct additionally 6 Skyloo latrines in the primary schools. Additionally the school would like to act as an knowledge centre on nutrition education and the implementation of schoolgardens.
Target Groups: Teacher students, of the Chilangoma Teachers Training Colleges in South West Education Division in Blantyre district, and primary school children.
